thread.title: Running with the Bulls in Pamplona, Spain - 2015 [Photos] [Video]
thread.title_full: Running with the Bulls in Pamplona, Spain - 2015 [Photos] [Video]

title: Running with the Bulls in Pamplona, Spain - 2015 [Photos] [Video]
text:
Wednesday, July 08, 2015 08:15 AM CDT Running with the Bulls in Pamplona, Spain - 2015 Previous Next 
Runners fall in front of Tajo y la Reina fighting bulls at the entrance to the bullring during the second running of the bulls of the San Fermin festival in Pamplona, northern Spain, July 8, 2015. One runner was gored in the run that lasted 2 minutes and 14 seconds, according to local media. REUTERS/Joseba Etxaburu REUTERS 
Runners fall beside two ''El Tajo-La Reina' fighting bulls during the second running of the bulls at the San Fermin Festival, in Pamplona, Spain, Wednesday, July 8, 2015. Revelers from around the world head to Pamplona every year to take part in the eight day long event. (AP Photo/Alvaro Barrientos) THE ASSOCIATED PRESS 
El Tajo y La Reina fighting bulls, and steers run after revelers during the running of the bulls, at the San Fermin festival, in Pamplona, Spain, Wednesday, July 8, 2015. Revelers from around the world arrive in Pamplona every year to take part in some of the eight days of the running of the bulls. (AP Photo/Andres Kudacki) AP 
Revelers run, chased by 'El Tajo y La Reina' ranch fighting bulls, as they turn Estafeta corner during a running of the bulls of the San Fermin festival in Pamplona, Spain, Wednesday, July 8, 2015. Revelers from around the world arrive in Pamplona every year to take part on some of the eight days of the running of the bulls. (AP Photo/Daniel Ochoa de Olza) THE ASSOCIATED PRESS 
A reveler calls the attention of an 'El Tajo y La Reina' ranch fighting bull as others keep running during the San Fermin festival in Pamplona, Spain, Wednesday, July 8, 2015. Revelers from around the world arrive in Pamplona every year to take part in the event. (AP Photo/Daniel Ochoa de Olza) AP 
El Tajo y La Reina fighting bulls and steers run after revelers during the running of the bulls, at the San Fermin festival, in Pamplona, Spain, Wednesday, July 8, 2015. Revelers from around the world arrive in Pamplona every year to take part in some of the eight days of the running of the bulls. (AP Photo/Andres Kudacki) AP 
A group of revelers wait for the arrival of an animal in the bull ring, at the San Fermin Festival, in Pamplona, Spain, Wednesday, July 8, 2015. Revelers from around the world arrive to Pamplona every year to take part in some of the eight days of the running of the bulls. (AP Photo/Alvaro Barrientos) AP 
A runner is knocked by a steer during the second running of the bulls at the San Fermin Festival, in Pamplona, Spain, Wednesday, July 8, 2015. Revelers from around the world arrive to Pamplona every year to take part in some of the eight days of the running of the bulls. (AP Photo/Alvaro Barrientos) AP 
Revelers run chased by 'El Tajo y La Reina' ranch fighting bulls as they turn Estafeta corner during a running of the bulls of the San Fermin festival in Pamplona, Spain, Wednesday, July 8, 2015. Revelers from around the world arrive in Pamplona every year to take part on some of the eight days of the running of the bulls. (AP Photo/Daniel Ochoa de Olza) AP 
A revelers is pushed by a cow in the bull ring, at the San Fermin Festival, in Pamplona, Spain, Wednesday, July 8, 2015. Revelers from around the world arrive in Pamplona every year to take part in some of the eight days of the running of the bulls. (AP Photo/Alvaro Barrientos) AP 
Kilikis help each other dress during San Fermin festival's "Comparsa de gigantes y cabezudos" (Parade of the Giants and Big Heads) in Pamplona, northern Spain, July 8, 2015. "Kilikis", wearing oversized masks as they playfully hit bystanders with sponges on sticks, parade daily through the city accompanied by brass bands during the nine-day-long festival made popular by U.S. writer Ernest Hemingway. REUTERS/Vincent West REUTERS 
A cow jumps over a group of revelers on the bull ring, at the San Fermin Festival, in Pamplona, Spain, Wednesday, July 8, 2015. Revelers from around the world arrive in Pamplona every year to take part in some of the eight days of the running of the bulls. (AP Photo/Alvaro Barrientos) AP 
TOPSHOTS A Del Tajo la Reina's bull falls during the second "encierro" (bull-run) of the San Fermin Festival in Pamplona, northern Spain, on July 8, 2015. The festival is a symbol of Spanish culture that attracts thousands of tourists to watch the bull runs despite heavy condemnation from animal rights groups. AFP PHOTO/ CESAR MANSO AFP 
A cow jumps over a group of revelers on the bull ring, at the San Fermin Festival, in Pamplona, Spain, Wednesday, July 8, 2015. Revelers from around the world arrive in Pamplona every year to take part in some of the eight days of the running of the bulls. (AP Photo/Alvaro Barrientos) THE ASSOCIATED PRESS 
A runner is pushed by a steer during the second running of the bulls, at the San Fermin Festival, in Pamplona, Spain, Wednesday, July 8, 2015. Revelers from around the world arrive in Pamplona every year to take part in some of the eight days of the running of the bulls. (AP Photo/Alvaro Barrientos) AP 
An "El Tajo y La Reina" ranch fighting bull touches the armpit of a reveler with his horn as they turn Estafeta corner during a running of the bulls of the San Fermin festival in Pamplona, Spain, Wednesday, July 8, 2015. Revelers from around the world arrive in Pamplona every year to take part on some of the eight days of the running of the bulls. (AP Photo/Daniel Ochoa de Olza) AP 
A cow jumps over a group of revelers in the bull ring, at the San Fermin Festival, in Pamplona, Spain, Wednesday, July 8, 2015. Revelers from around the world arrive in Pamplona every year to take part in some of the eight days of the running of the bulls. (AP Photo/Alvaro Barrientos) AP 
People watch as El Tajo y La Reina fighting bulls and revelers run during the running of the bulls, at the San Fermin festival, in Pamplona, Spain, Wednesday, July 8, 2015. Revelers from around the world arrive in Pamplona every year to take part in some of the eight days of the running of the bulls. (AP Photo/Andres Kudacki) AP 
Revelers run, chased by 'El Tajo y La Reina' ranch fighting bulls, as they turn Estafeta corner during a running of the bulls of the San Fermin festival in Pamplona, Spain, Wednesday, July 8, 2015. Revelers from around the world arrive in Pamplona every year to take part on some of the eight days of the running of the bulls. (AP Photo/Daniel Ochoa de Olza) AP 
Revelers are chased by a brave bull from the "El Tajo y La Reina" ranch as they turn Estafeta corner during a running of the bulls of the San Fermin festival in Pamplona, Spain, Wednesday, July 8, 2015. Revelers from around the world arrive in Pamplona every year to take part on some of the eight days of the running of the bulls. (AP Photo/Daniel Ochoa de Olza) AP 
Kilikis help each other dress during San Fermin festival's "Comparsa de gigantes y cabezudos" (Parade of the Giants and Big Heads) in Pamplona, northern Spain, July 8, 2015. "Kilikis", wearing oversized masks as they playfully hit bystanders with sponges on sticks, parade daily through the city accompanied by brass bands during the nine-day-long festival made popular by U.S. writer Ernest Hemingway. REUTERS/Eloy Alonso ATTENTION EDITORS: SPANISH LAW REQUIRES THAT THE FACES OF MINORS ARE MASKED IN PUBLICATIONS WITHIN SPAIN REUTERS 
El Tajo y La Reina fighting bull, right, and a steer, run after revelers during the running of the bulls, at the San Fermin festival, in Pamplona, Spain, Wednesday, July 8, 2015. Revelers from around the world arrive in Pamplona every year to take part in some of the eight days of the running of the bulls. (AP Photo/Andres Kudacki) AP

Revelers from around the world arrive in Pamplona every year to take part in some of the eight days of the running of the bulls. (AP Photo/Andres Kudacki) AP

Revelers from around the world arrive in Pamplona every year to take part in some of the eight days of the running of the bulls. (AP Photo/Alvaro Barrientos) THE ASSOCIATED PRESS 
Runners sprint alongside Tajo y la Reina fighting bulls at the town hall during the second running of the bulls of the San Fermin festival in Pamplona, northern Spain, July 8, 2015. One runner was gored in the run that lasted 2 minutes and 14 seconds, according to local media. REUTERS/Vincent West REUTERS 
A reveller sleeps on a bench after the second running of the bulls of the San Fermin festival in Pamplona, northern Spain, July 8, 2015. One runner was gored in the run that lasted 2 minutes and 14 seconds, according to local media. REUTERS/Susana Vera TPX IMAGES OF THE DAY REUTERS 
Revelers are chased by a bull from the 'El Tajo y La Reina' ranch during the San Fermin festival in Pamplona, Spain, Wednesday, July 8, 2015. Revelers from around the world head to Pamplona every year to take part in the eight day long event. (AP Photo/Daniel Ochoa de Olza) AP
